intro: Afrosolen, commonly known as the African yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slight hairy texture. Afrosolen thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
